title: How to Perform Puja to Krishna

steps.title: Take a bath before performing the puja and mark your forehead with ashtagandha (sandalwood) or gopi chandan (mud of Vrindavan).
steps.content: Take a bath before performing the puja and mark your forehead with ashtagandha (sandalwood) or gopi chandan (mud of Vrindavan).

steps.title: Place a white cotton cloth on a clean table or surface.
steps.content: Place a white cotton cloth on a clean table or surface. You need to put a Lord Krishna murti or image at the center of the altar in a large deep container. Arrange a puja plate with water to sprinkle, kumkum powder, sandalwood paste, incense, aarti lamp and flowers. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Arrange another plate with sattvic foods and fruit, water to drink and more flowers.
steps.content: Arrange another plate with sattvic foods and fruit, water to drink and more flowers. Take a ghee (clarified butter) or sesame oil deepam (lamp) and place it there, unlit.

steps.title: When all is set up, you do achaman by taking a spoon with your left hand, dripping some water on your right hand and saying "Om achyutaya namaha" and drink it quietly.
steps.content: When all is set up, you do achaman by taking a spoon with your left hand, dripping some water on your right hand and saying "Om achyutaya namaha" and drink it quietly. Take more water and say "Om anantaya namaha" and drink. Last mantra "Om Govindaya namaha" and drink, then put water on both hands and dry them. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Chant the brahma samhita and other mantras and shlokas from the Vedas, Puranas and Upanishads while bathing the Deity with milk, ghee, orange juice, flowers and simple water.
steps.content: Chant the brahma samhita and other mantras and shlokas from the Vedas, Puranas and Upanishads while bathing the Deity with milk, ghee, orange juice, flowers and simple water. Dry the murti and put that bowl aside. [4] X Research source Place the food, flowers, water and ghee diya next to Him after abhishekam (the bath)

steps.title: Apply sandalwood paste on Lord Krishna's idol.
steps.content: Apply sandalwood paste on Lord Krishna's idol. Begin chanting the prayer shubham karoti kalyanam and light the diya. Then say gurur brahma gurur vishnu.... then, you chant any Krishna bhajan that you like and offer an incense stick 7 times in a circular clockwise motion. Then the arti lamp with 1 or 5 wicks, and then offer the chamara wisk to scare flies, so that Lord would be comfortable.

steps.title: Place a little kumkum at Lord Krishna's feet and then to your forehead as a tilak and distribute the prasada kumkum to devotees around.
steps.content: Place a little kumkum at Lord Krishna's feet and then to your forehead as a tilak and distribute the prasada kumkum to devotees around. [5] X Research source The offered kumkum has been accepted and blessed by the Lord and applying it to others acts as a medium to transmit Lord Krishna's blessings. Tilak is also used to purify and sanctify the body and to open /stimulate and protect the adnya chakra. Blow the conch shell to finish the worship ceremony and ask forgiveness for mistakes during the archana, wrongdoings or forgetting something during puja. You can leave there the offerings of fruits, water, naivedyas, flowers and rice for some time for God to enjoy and later eat them as prasad or you can later immerse them in flowing water or distribute to other people. Now you can sashtang pranaam to God

steps.title: You can do japa meditation with "Hare krishna" or OM NAMO BHAGAVATE VASUDEVAYA[6] X Research source after puja.
steps.content: You can do japa meditation with "Hare krishna" or OM NAMO BHAGAVATE VASUDEVAYA [6] X Research source after puja.

steps.title: Offer a flower, ghee lamp and incense along with a prayer or gratitude.
steps.content: Offer a flower, ghee lamp and incense along with a prayer or gratitude. Put fruit or water in altar daily.
